SEARCH
Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.smtp.client.handler

Interface ServerGreeting

All Superinterfaces:
ClientHandler
public interface ServerGreeting extends ClientHandler
Handler interface for receiving the initial SMTP server greeting.

This is the entry point for SMTP client handlers. When connecting to an SMTP server, the handler passed to SMTPClient.connect() must implement this interface to receive the server's initial greeting and begin the session.

After receiving the greeting, the handler should issue either EHLO (for Extended SMTP) or HELO (for basic SMTP) to establish the session. The esmtp parameter indicates whether the server advertised ESMTP support in its greeting, which helps the handler decide which command to use.

Example usage: 


 public class MyMailHandler implements ServerGreeting {
     
     public void handleGreeting(String message, boolean esmtp, ClientHelloState hello) {
         if (esmtp) {
             hello.ehlo("my.hostname.com", new MyEhloHandler());
         } else {
             hello.helo("my.hostname.com", new MyHeloHandler());
         }
     }
     
     public void handleServiceUnavailable(String message) {
         log.error("Server unavailable: {}", message);
     }
     
     // ... ClientHandler methods ...
 }
Author:
Chris Burdess

  • Method Details

    • handleGreeting

      void handleGreeting(String message, boolean esmtp, ClientHelloState hello)
      Called when the server sends a successful greeting (220).

      The handler should respond by issuing either EHLO or HELO to establish the session. Use the esmtp parameter to determine which command is appropriate.

      Parameters:
      message - the greeting text (e.g., "mail.example.com ESMTP ready")
      esmtp - true if the server advertised ESMTP support in the greeting
      hello - operations available to begin the session

    • handleServiceUnavailable

      void handleServiceUnavailable(String message)
      Called when the server is not accepting connections.

      This is invoked for non-220 greeting responses (typically 421). The connection will be closed after this callback returns.

      Parameters:
      message - the server's rejection message
